p: The content of phenolic compounds was investigated in the foliar, cortical and xylem tissues of rosemary. The HPLC profile of the extracts from cortical and xylem tissues showed a lack of those phenolic compounds typically present in rosemary leaves (e.g., rosmarinic acid, carnosic acid, carnosol, etc.), while only negligible amounts of caffeic acid derivatives and flavonoids were detected. Consequently, Table 1 shows only the quantitative distribution of phenols in young and mature leaves (LY and LMu).
